content.description:
A must-do classic right around the corner from

Pratt's Crack

. Follows a huge, clean-cut dihedral starting from the top of a 4th class ramp.

An initial tricky finger crack on the right face leads to a long section of hand jams in the corner. A burly lieback up a brief overhanging offwidth leads to a final short chimney. Traverse right, passing the anchors for Queen of Heartbreaks to the anchors for Sheila (directly above the chimney).
content.protection:
Cams from micro to 3". Optional #6 for upper lieback.

Rappel with 2 ropes. A single 80m just reaches with stretch, or might require a few feet of 4th class downclimbing.
content.location:
Pratt's Crack area, on the right side. A large corner whose right face is split by a large roof 1/3 of the way up.

Scramble up 50' of 4th class to a bolted belay below a tree and the start of the real climbing.

content.description: Scramble up to the ledge just below 'Sheila'. Use the belay bolt to protect the easy moves to the first bolt and deal with immediate arete cruxyness at the second bolt. Once you grab the jugs clip the third bolt and pull into the dihedral. Stem your way up the fun dihedral until it runs dry. When you get to the roof, pull around left and onto the face. Touch 'Sheila' for a brief moment and then head right. Climb forever on the amazing face using incredible little crimper jugs. After climbing 125ft. the holds vanish and your options become limited. Clip the last bolt and float through the heartbreaker of a finish. DON'T CHEAT THE ROUTE AND BAIL LEFT! Go straight up the blank looking face to the anchor. This climb is center stage and classic! I can't believe it wasn't climbed sooner.
content.protection:
17 bolts

chain anchors w/fixe steel biners

-use two ropes to get off or an 80m.
content.location: To the right of 'Sheila' and to the left of 'Eclipsed'.

content.description:
Ridicu-classic and surprisingly secure.

A long and beautiful offwidth in a giant clean-cut dihedral.  This is one of the most obvious lines in the canyon.  If you're up for a good grovel then hop on.

During colder months, hit this early in the morning as it dips into the shade around noon, maybe earlier.  In fact you may not see it at all.  Tends to be a windy canyon.  Two 60 meter ropes to rappel.
content.protection: Gear to 10", small TCU's useful deep in the secondary crack, BIG camalots and friends (#6), up to blue big bro (but not necessary), and chockstones. Mussy hooks at the anchor.
content.location: You can see the route from the road on the left side of the two giant dihedrals. "Pratt's" splits the classic white Sierra granite on the right and the dark patina wall on the left.  Hard to miss!

content.description: Start up a seam just inside of the arete, on the clean face to climber's right of Pratt's Crack.  Then veer out to the arete and up.  P1 via 16 bolts ends at a rap anchor at about same height as that of Pratt's Crack to the left.  P2 veers left back onto the same face above for another 8 bolts to the upper anchor.

From the 2 bolt belay, traverse a thin face for 3 bolts - the traverse gets tougher as you go.  Then head up the nice clean arete.  Like the traverse, the arete gets progressively harder, with the crux coming on off-vertical thin moves near the top.

Feels rewarding.
content.protection: 8(?) 1/4" bolts.  To a 2 bolt (3/8") anchor.  The bolts appear to be in good shape.
content.location: Eclipsed is the right-most climb in the Dihedrals area. It starts about 30' off the deck, at a 2 bolt belay.  With a 70m rope you can definitely lower off to flat ground.  I'm not sure if you could with a 60m.
